result.execSummary:
The defendant Donnell T Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donnell T Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Donnell T Johnson was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by the end of supervision on case 14CF5247.  If not paid, entry of a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentence on case 14CF5247.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Received and Filed:
Notice of right to seek post conviction relief
Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with zero days credit CONCURRENT with sentence on case 14CF5247.  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by the end of supervision on case 14CF5247 or, if not paid, entry of a civil judgment.
Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant Donnell T Johnson in custody.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant prepared to enter a change of plea. Plea hearing proceeded.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
AS TO COUNT 2:
On motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.
Case proceeded to sentencing.

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant Donnell T Johnson in custody.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense again requests more time.  Court orders case be scheduled for final pre-trial.  Court will accept case 15CF2143 for global resolution if the defense can provide a transcript of the victims statement.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Donnell T Johnson in custody.  Paul Hauer for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defense Counsel requests sequestration of all State's witnesses. Sworn for the state:Matthew Diener-MPD Officer.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents and bail/bond form regarding case #14CF5247 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
